1. Getting rid of the penny won't harm consumers or businesses:

Many thanks to Raymond Lombra and Robert Whaples for providing the data used in their papers:
Raymond Lombra
https://www.jstor.org/stable/40326060#metadata_info_tab_contents
Robert Whaples
http://web.holycross.edu/RePEc/eej/Archive/Volume33/V33N1P139_146.pdf

2. The penny costs the government millions each year:

LiveScience
https://www.livescience.com/32401-whats-a-penny-made-of.html
Quartz
https://www.theatlas.com/charts/r1Yc_aQGQ
Coin News
http://www.coinnews.net/2018/02/26/penny-costs-1-82-cents-to-make-in-2017/
Coin Update
http://news.coinupdate.com/us-mint-cost-to-produce-the-penny-and-nickel-0137/

3. Pennies have no value:

Missouri Libraries: prices and wages by decade
https://libraryguides.missouri.edu/pricesandwages

Chocolate by Korokoro from the Noun Project
